subject: AI & Agents
title: Procedural Generation in Games
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Procedural Generation in Games.

hook.text: No Man's Sky has 18 quintillion planets. No human designed any of them. Algorithms did.

buildup.text: Procedural generation uses algorithms to create game content â€” levels, terrain, quests â€” automatically.

discovery.text: Rules define constraints. Randomness adds variety. The result: infinite unique worlds.

twist.text: Quantity doesn't equal quality. Procedural worlds often feel repetitive without hand-crafted moments.

climax.text: The best games blend procedural generation with human-designed narrative and landmarks.

punchline.text: Infinite worlds are easy. Interesting ones are hard.

quiz.question: What is the main limitation of procedural generation?
options: Generated content can feel repetitive without hand-crafted design
